searchDocs.title: Escaping Data
searchDocs.content: Escaping Data If you need to use commas , within the value of your offers (for example in a title or a description) then we expect the csv cell to be enclosed in quotes " according to RFC4180. For more information about our CSV support see our CSV file format article. Fields containing line breaks (CRLF), double quotes, and commas should be enclosed in double-quotes. Example: "aaa","b CRLF bb","ccc" CRLF zzz,yyy,xxx Don¬¥t escape using backslash We do not support dialects where escaping characters is done by putting a backslash \ before the value.

searchDocs.title: Advanced
searchDocs.content: Advanced üìÑÔ∏è File Encoding In order for computers to understand each other and to be able to represent the large amount of different languages characters and symbols, encodings are needed. Encodings are a way of defining a set where numbers correspond to a certain symbol. üìÑÔ∏è Url Encoding What Is An Url? üóÉÔ∏è XML 2 items üóÉÔ∏è CSV 1 item The advanced section contains in depth articles of some topics that might need some extra attention in order to get everything right.

searchDocs.title: Supported File Encodings‚Äã
searchDocs.content: We support the following encodings (and only these, see below)  utf-8utf-8-sig (or utf-8 with BOM)asciiwindows-1252iso-8859-1 (also called latin1)

searchDocs.title: UTF8‚Äã
searchDocs.content: We strongly recommend you to stick to UTF-8 as this is the most common used character encoding for the web and it is also the recommended encoding in the HTML 5 Specification.  Learn about UTF 8 Here is a good explanation from YouTuber Alex that explains UTF-8 encoding.

searchDocs.title: In Practice‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You can use multiple common tools or programming languages in order to create UTF-8 encoded files.

searchDocs.title: Using a Text Editor‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Open your file in a good text editor like Sublime TextClick¬†File¬†in the top-left cornerClick¬†Save with Encoding...Click UTF-8

searchDocs.title: Using Programming‚Äã
searchDocs.content: PythonC#JavaRust from pathlib import Path file_path.write_text(content, "utf-8")

searchDocs.title: Why Not More Encodings?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: There are multiple other encodings not listed above. We do not support sending us files using other encodings than the list above. This is a decision taken weighing in complexity vs benefit vs error proneness.

searchDocs.title: References‚Äã
searchDocs.content: RFC3629WikipediaHTML 5 Specification

searchDocs.title: Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Before we explain how to encode URLs, here is what we expect regarding urls:  They must follow RFC39862They must be absolute (we do not accept relative urls)They must have a scheme (http/https)They must have an authority (your domain usually)They must have a path (a single product or image are never placed in the root of a domain)They may have parameters but the parameters values must be properly URL encodedThey may have anchors (also called fragment) but the anchors must be properly URL encoded

searchDocs.title: Encoding‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In order to make a long RFC specification short, do this when passing urls to us:  TIP: Use an encoding tool In order to test conversion and encoding you can use one of the many available online tools, one such example is Coder¬¥s Toolbox for encoding URL values and the Internationalized Domain Name (IDN) Conversion Tool for converting domain names.  Ensure that domain contain only ascii characters, unicode characters should be encoded3Ensure that all path sections contain only ascii characters, unicode characters should be encoded4Ensure that all parameter keys contain only ascii characters, unicode characters should be encoded4Ensure that all parameter values contain only ascii characters, unicode characters should be encoded4Ensure that all anchor values contain only ascii characters, unicode characters should be encoded4

searchDocs.title: Example‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If we look at a product url like this  https://mittf√∂retag.com/categories/√∂verlevnadsutrustning/super ficklampa?strength=extra-bright!#buy‚Äînow   We would expect it in the format of  https://xn--mittfretag-icb.com/categories/%C3%B6verlevnadsutrustning/super%20ficklampa?strength=extra-bright!#buy%E2%80%94now

searchDocs.title: Breakdown‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In the example above the following encodings have taken place.  Domain name‚Äã  mittf√∂retag.com to xn--mittfretag-icb.com According to IDN3  Path‚Äã  /categories/√∂verlevnadsutrustning/super ficklampa to /categories/%C3%B6verlevnadsutrustning/super%20ficklampa according to percent encoding4  Parameter values‚Äã  extra-bright! to extra-bright! since here is nothing to do, all characters are already plain ascii  Do not encode parameter separators‚Äã  If a questionmark ? or an ampersand & are meant to separate parameters, then they should not be encoded. But if they are a part of the value or the parameter name, then they should be encoded. Please compare:  ?movietitle=Godfather&rating=5 # should be unchanged when encoded ?movietitle=Godfather&rating=5   vs  ?movietitle=Tom & Jerry&rating=5 # the ampersand in Tom & Jerry should be encoded, but not the ampersand separating the rating parameter ?movietitle=Tom%20%26%20Jerry&rating=5   It is a common mistake to simply encode the whole query parameter string. Instead you should encode the parameter names and parameter values separately before combining them.  Anchor‚Äã  buy‚Äînow to buy%E2%80%94now according to percent encoding, the dash is a unicode character U+2014 called emdash4  Invisible characters and dashes are hard Unicode contains a lot of different representations of whitespaces, dashes and other hard-to-see-the-difference characters. But if you do url encoding programatically of everything you will ensure that things work properly. If you suspect that any of these characters exist in your url then paste it in an encoding tool like Coder¬¥s Toolbox and see if it will be percent encoded.

searchDocs.title: Why So Strict?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The URLs passed in for your products will be sent to a lot of systems (ours, partners, customer devices). Some of these systems are more liberal than others in accepting unicode characters and other symbols directly (browsers are very liberal), but some are not (for example older phones). We don¬¥t want to break the experience for any customer who is using our product in order to find your products and make a purchase. Hence we require well formed URLs that will work across the broadest range of devices and systems.

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: XML stands for eXtensinble Markup Language. It is very similar to HTML except it doesn't have any predefined tags. It's a meta language that allows you to define your own markup language which then can be used to store and share data in a structured manner.

searchDocs.title: Namespaces‚Äã
searchDocs.content: A Prisjakt offer feed should use two namespaces, the g namespace which most fields belong to that are defined by the Google Product Specification and then the pj namespace which contains some additional Prisjakt specific fields defined by us.  Offers: https://schema.prisjakt.nu/ns/1.0  <rss xmlns:pj="https://schema.prisjakt.nu/ns/1.0" xmlns:g="http://base.google.com/ns/1.0" version="3.0">   Promotions: https://schema.prisjakt.nu/ns/promotions-1.0  <rss xmlns:pj="https://schema.prisjakt.nu/ns/promotions-1.0" xmlns:g="http://base.google.com/ns/1.0" version="3.0">

searchDocs.title: Namespace Priority When Parsed‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If multiple fields with the same name but different namespaces exist, the field will be parsed with the following priority:  pj: first eg. <pj:some_field>Some pj field</pj:some_field>g: second eg. <g:some_field>Gome g field</g:some_field>no namespace third eg. <some_field>Some field</some_field>other/unknown in undefined order eg. <xyz:some_field>Some xyz field</xyz:some_field>

searchDocs.title: Use UTF-8‚Äã
searchDocs.content: All XML feeds should start with the following header and the files should be properly UTF-8 encoded.  Do not use control characters in feed file. We support some of them trying to follow XML spec but not guarantee to fully support it.  <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>

searchDocs.title: Use CDATA‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You should lower the risk of your data causing xml parsers to fail because of invalid data by encoding your data correctly. Take a look on our CDATA article to achieve this.

searchDocs.title: Format‚Äã
searchDocs.content: We expect the following structure (following RFC4180) on CSV files, for a full example please see the CSV tab on our full example  First row is a header row Example: column_header_one,column_header_two,column_header_three value_1,value_2,value_3 Columns are separated by commas , Rows are separated by newlines \n Cells that contains newlines or commas must be quoted using double qoutes " Example: aaa,"my title, which contains a comma",ccc If double-quotes are used to enclose fields, then a double-quote appearing inside a field must be escaped by preceding it with another double quote. Example: "aaa","b""bb","ccc"

searchDocs.title: Escaping‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Escaping values in CSV can be tricky, see our section about escaping for more details

searchDocs.title: Encoding sub-attributes and lists in CSV files‚Äã
searchDocs.content: While the XML format is well suited for sub-attributes (child elements) and lists (repeated elements), the CSV format is not so.  In the CSV format, sub-attributes are added to an attribute as a list inside parentheses. The list of sub-attributes is separated by colon (:). For example, to specify sub-attributes to the shipping attribute:  othercol1,shipping(country:service:price),othercol2 otherval1,SE:standard:10.99 SEK,otherval2   In the CSV format, lists are simply defined as repeated columns with the same name. Here are two shipping services:  othercol1,shipping(country:service:price),shipping(country:service:price),othercol2 otherval1,SE:standard:10.99 SEK,NO:standard:10.99 SEK,otherval2

searchDocs.title: References‚Äã
searchDocs.content: RFC4180

searchDocs.title: FAQ
searchDocs.content: FAQ How does the Prisjakt Feed relate to Google Merchant Product Specification? Prisjakt feed specification is compatible with Google Merchant feeds. This means that if you have a Google Product feed, it can be used as a Prisjakt feed. In most cases the opposite is also true, you can use a Prisjakt Feed in systems that supports Google Product Feeds (although we do support some extra fields they may not be used by the other system). How does the Prisjakt Feed relate to Amazon Marketplace Feeds? We support reading feeds formatted according to Amazon Marketplace format but with fewer data mapped than if you use our format. How does the Prisjakt Feed relate to Amazon Deal Feeds? We support reading feeds formatted according to Amazon Deals format but with fewer data mapped than if you use our format. What is the offer feed? Offer feed contains information about your products. It is the most common feed type and is used to update prices and stock status on Prisjakt. What is the promotion feed? Promotions feed contains information about your promotions. It is used to update promotions on Prisjakt.

searchDocs.title: Special Characters in XML
searchDocs.content: Special Characters in XML It is possible to escape special characters in XML (see this answer and this answer) using number notations such as this example: Joe's Caf√© & Bar ‚ô´ escaped using number notation: TIP: Use an encoding tool In order to test conversion and encoding you can use one of the many available online tools, one such example is Coder¬¥s Toolbox for encoding URL values. Joe&#39;s Caf&#233; &amp; Bar &#9835; But in the case of product feeds, you should never need to do this as long as your XML file is UTF-8 encoded and that all fields containing strings are wrapped in CDATA tags. Please note that for URLs we are more strict and require them to be url encoded properly according to RFC specification.

searchDocs.title: CDATA in XML Files
searchDocs.content: CDATA in XML Files Since XML is a tag based language: <tag>content</tag> some characters like brackets (< or >) are reserved for the XML markup itself. If your data contains these characters it may cause a parser to become confused. We recommend that you embed all fields that contain string values in CDATA tags in order to avoid the risk of your content causing troubles for our parser. <g:field><![CDATA[your complex string with special xml markup characters]]></g:field> Here you can see an example of CDATA on a google_product_category. Even if the data contains brackets > and special characters like & they will parse successfully and without the need for encoding when wrapped in a CDATA tag. <g:google_product_category><![CDATA[Animals & Pet Supplies > Pet Supplies > Reptile & Amphibian Supplies]]></g:google_product_category> Your Data Beware that even if you do not have any data containing these special characters today, you might add a product at a later stage that have these special characters in it¬¥s description or other string fields. Hence we recommend to always use CDATA wrapping in order to avoid unexpected errors in the future.

searchDocs.title: Feed Types‚Äã
searchDocs.content: We support feeds for different types of integration with us.  Offer feed is the most common feed type, compatible with Google Merchant Feed and is the way shops provide us with prices and stock status.Product feed is intended for manufacturers who wants to provide us with detailed product information of the products they create.Promotion feed is a way for shops to automate promotion campaigns through us. Visible at the promotions page.Local shop feed is for you who have shops in multiple physical locations. This feeds helps us define your shop information such as opening hours and address.Local inventory offer feed is use in conjunction with Local Shop Feeds to provide local-specific availability, prices and shipping options.

searchDocs.title: Pull Based Delivery Flow‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The default flow of reding the feeds is simply that you provide an URL to us and we will periodically read it and update it. Frequency depends on the type of feed and your SLA level.

searchDocs.title: Push Based Delivery Flow‚Äã
searchDocs.content: It is also possible to upload the feed to us, either via the user iterface in Business Center or via our Feed API (contact support for credentials).

searchDocs.title: Local Offer Fields
searchDocs.content: Local Offer Fields üìÑÔ∏è availability Use the availability attribute to display your stock status. Please note that the values of this field (which is for the local shop offer) differs from [`availability`](/feeds/offer/fields/availability.md) on the high level offer. üìÑÔ∏è id Identifier should be unique for every product and not be changed or re-used for other products, a good practice is to use SKUs as ids since they are unique. üìÑÔ∏è local_shipping_label Label that you assign to a product to help assign shipping in Google Merchant Center. **Not used** by Prisjakt. üìÑÔ∏è pickup_method Specifies what available pickup options exists for your shop. üìÑÔ∏è pickup_sla Specifies the expected date when an order will be ready for pickup, relative to when the order is placed. üìÑÔ∏è price Your products price in the specific shop referenced by [`store_code`](/feeds/local-offer/fields/store_code.md). üìÑÔ∏è quantity The number of items in stock for the shop üìÑÔ∏è sale_price Your product's sale price üìÑÔ∏è sale_price_effective_date The date range during which the sale price applies üìÑÔ∏è store_code Identifier to specify which local shop this local offer belongs to. **NOTE** Google uses the terminology of __store__ and the field in the offer feed but uses the terminology **shop** in the store feed. Prisjakt uses the terminology of **shop** everywhere but must follow googles example in the files here for compatability reasons. These fields are available in Local inventory offer feeds.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Local inventory offer feeds defines local-specific offer information such as availability and local prices. Local shop feeds defines your shop information. These two feed types should always be used together.

searchDocs.title: Via URL‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Create/generate a feed (or let your E-commerce tool generate it for youHost the feed on your own server and provide us with a url to fetch it from regularlyAdd the url in Business Center Make sure to choose the Local inventory offer feed type when adding

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use the availability attribute to display your stock status. Please note that the values of this field (which is for the local shop offer) differs from availability on the high level offer.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Enables us to indicate if a customer can order the product

searchDocs.title: Allowed Enum Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: in_stock You have more than 3 items or more available in your local inventory. out_of_stock Items with 0 in quantity limited_availability You have two or less items in your local inventory. on_display_to_order Items that are displayed in-shop, but not immediately available for purchase: Such as large furniture items, or different sizes and colors of a display model.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Value must be one of the allowed enum values

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use up-to-date stock info

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Don't use out of stock when the shop is temporarily downDon't use out of stock when you want to remove the product from the listingDon't use out of stock for products that are discontinued

searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid availability value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively. searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Specifies the expected date when an order will be ready for pickup, relative to when the order is placed.

searchDocs.title: Allowed Enum Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: same day Indicates that the product is available for pickup the same day that the order is placed, subject to cut off times. next day Indicates that the product is available for pickup the following day that the order is placed. 2-day Indicates that the product will be shipped to a shop for a customer to pick up in 2 days. 3-day Indicates that the product will be shipped to a shop for a customer to pick up in 3 days. 4-day Indicates that the product will be shipped to a shop for a customer to pick up in 4 days 5-day Indicates that the product will be shipped to a shop for a customer to pick up in 5 days. 6-day Indicates that the product will be shipped to a shop for a customer to pick up in 6 days. multi-week Indicates that the product will be shipped to a shop for a customer to pick up in one week or more.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Required to enable shop pickupValue must be one of the allowed enum values

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Your products price in the specific shop referenced by store_code.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Must be a number (value) followed by a space and a currency (unit)Number may have two decimals, separated by a . (dot)Currency must be three upper case characters and a valid ISO 4217 currencyZero prices are not allowed

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Submit price if your item has a different price per shopThe inventory data price will override the price in the product data feed for the associated shop.Accurately submit the product's price and currency, and match with the price from your shopsEnsure that the product can be purchased in-shop for the submitted price.For products sold in bulk quantities, bundles, or multipacks: Submit the total price of the minimum purchasable quantity, bundle, or multipack.For the US and Canada: Don't include tax in the price.For all other countries:Include value added tax (VAT) or Goods and Services Tax (GST) in the price.

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Do not include extra charges in the cost (such as shipping cost)Do not use thousand separators or similar in the value (while we may handle some of these cases we recommend you to just send plain numbers like 10000.50 SEK)

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid price value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively.  XMLCSV Valid Value <g:price>99.99 SEK</g:price> Click to show more valid XML examples <g:price>99.99 SEK</g:price> <g:price>100 SEK</g:price> <g:price>SEK 100</g:price> <g:price>99,99 SEK</g:price> <g:price>10,000.00 SEK</g:price> <g:price>10 000.00 SEK</g:price> <g:price>10.000 SEK</g:price> <g:price>1.144.000 SEK</g:price>

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The date range during which the sale price applies

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This will cause sale_price to be applied only within interval specified by start and end datetime

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Standard: ISO 8601Up to 51 charactersTwo dates separated with "/" (ISO 8601)Start and end must be within one year from current date

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Start datetime shall be earlier than stop datetime

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you don't include time, start time default to 12 AM CET (midnight) of start day and stop time is set to 23:59:59 of stop dayDon't set start or end datetime further than one year in the future. This will cause warning in feed validation. Moreover sale_price_effective_date and sale_price won't be used in product listing.

Prisjakt uses the terminology of shop everywhere but must follow googles example in the files here for compatability reasons.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Local shop feeds contain local shop information such as opening hours, name, address etc. It is the same format as Google Merchant Business Profile Manager and can be sent as CSV or XLSX files.  Local inventory offer feeds defines local-specific offer information such as availability and local prices. These two feed types should always be used together.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Our feed format is an extension of the Google Merchant Local Product Data Specification, and as such these fields will be usable for other systems that support Google Local Product Data Feeds.  Field Requirements We require full offer information and do not accept local offer updates on single fields, always supply the full offer.

searchDocs.title: Local Shop Fields
searchDocs.content: Local Shop Fields üìÑÔ∏è address_line_1 Street number and street name. Suite numbers, floors, building numbers, etc. may also be included. üìÑÔ∏è business_name The name of your shop, as shown on public sources. üìÑÔ∏è country_region Must be a two letter ISO 3166-1 country code üìÑÔ∏è friday_hours Describes opening hours for a given day, can be multiple sets or indicate closed. When you have different hours for a short period use the field [`special_hours`](/feeds/local-shop/fields/special_hours.md). üìÑÔ∏è latitude Longitude and latitude is used to locate your shop in the cases if we cannot lookup your address. üìÑÔ∏è locality The city/town or place where your shop resides. üìÑÔ∏è longitude Longitude and latitude is used to locate your shop in the cases if we cannot lookup your address. üìÑÔ∏è monday_hours Describes opening hours for a given day, can be multiple sets or indicate closed. When you have different hours for a short period use the field [`special_hours`](/feeds/local-shop/fields/special_hours.md). üìÑÔ∏è postcode The postal code of the business. üìÑÔ∏è primary_phone A phone number that connects the caller to your business as direct as possible. üìÑÔ∏è saturday_hours Describes opening hours for a given day, can be multiple sets or indicate closed. When you have different hours for a short period use the field [`special_hours`](/feeds/local-shop/fields/special_hours.md). üìÑÔ∏è shop_code A unique code identifying the shop. Use this code to attache local offers to your store when uploading local offer inventory. **NOTE** Google uses the terminology of __store__ and the field is named accordingly due to compatibility reasons, but Prisjakt uses the terminology of **shop** for all other uses. üìÑÔ∏è special_hours You can set special hours if your business temporarily adjusts its hours of operation or remains closed for up to 6 days in a row. üìÑÔ∏è sunday_hours Describes opening hours for a given day, can be multiple sets or indicate closed. When you have different hours for a short period use the field [`special_hours`](/feeds/local-shop/fields/special_hours.md). üìÑÔ∏è thursday_hours Describes opening hours for a given day, can be multiple sets or indicate closed. When you have different hours for a short period use the field [`special_hours`](/feeds/local-shop/fields/special_hours.md). üìÑÔ∏è tuesday_hours Describes opening hours for a given day, can be multiple sets or indicate closed. When you have different hours for a short period use the field [`special_hours`](/feeds/local-shop/fields/special_hours.md). üìÑÔ∏è wednesday_hours Describes opening hours for a given day, can be multiple sets or indicate closed. When you have different hours for a short period use the field [`special_hours`](/feeds/local-shop/fields/special_hours.md). These fields are available in local shop feeds.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: A unique code identifying the shop. Use this code to attache local offers to your store when uploading local offer inventory. searchDocs.title: Via URL‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Create/generate a feed (or let your E-commerce tool generate it for youHost the feed on your own server and provide us with a url to fetch it from regularlyAdd the url in Business Center Make sure to choose the Offer feed type when adding Benefits: You can update the feed whenever you wantYou can see when we last fetched the feedYou can see if there are any errors in the feedChanges propagate fast (within hours depending on your SLA)

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Offer feeds contain offers from a shop to customers and should be created in the format specified in this section.

searchDocs.title: Delivery‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To send us a feed, these are the main steps:  Create/generate a feed (or let your E-commerce tool generate it for youThen add the URL in your self service area in Business CenterThen we will then fetch the feed from the url you provided on a scheduled basis

searchDocs.title: Fields
searchDocs.content: Fields üìÑÔ∏è additional_image_link Used to add additional image links. The images may include different angles, colours etc. This gives the user the option to view different variants that might exist for a product. üìÑÔ∏è adult Should be used for tagging products for an adult audience. Not used to describe [`age_group`](/feeds/offer/fields/age_group.md), but for specific product types, such as sex toys. üìÑÔ∏è affiliate_link Add this attribute if you're using affiliate platform tracking. üìÑÔ∏è age_group Sets the demographic age your product is designed for. üìÑÔ∏è availability Use the availability attribute to display your stock status. üìÑÔ∏è availability_date This field is used together with [`availability`](/feeds/offer/fields/availability.md) for `preorder` or `backorder` values. üìÑÔ∏è brand The brand attribute is used to indicate a product's brand/manufacturer name. üìÑÔ∏è color Describe your product's color. Using this attribute is strongly recommended for Fashion and Beauty categories. Add it to improve search results and listing. üìÑÔ∏è condition State the condition of the product you are selling for your customers. üìÑÔ∏è condition_grade Use this attribute to provide a grade for the condition of the product. üìÑÔ∏è description Use it to add unstructured product information üìÑÔ∏è energy_efficiency_class It's strongly recommended to use this attribute for Electronics/Household Appliances categories. üìÑÔ∏è gender Specify the gender your product is designed for. üìÑÔ∏è google_product_category This attribute is used to help us place products in relevant categories. It should contain full category path from Google Taxonomy or respective category id. If you don't know or have Google product category, submit [`product_type`](/feeds/offer/fields/product_type.md) instead. üìÑÔ∏è gtin Use the GTIN attribute to submit a [Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) | GS1](https://www.gs1.org/standards/id-keys/gtin). A GTIN uniquely identifies your product. Including this will help indexing your products faster on Pricespy. üìÑÔ∏è id Identifier should be unique for every product and not be changed or re-used for other products, a good practice is to use SKUs as ids since they are unique. üìÑÔ∏è image_link Add it to improve search results and listing. If you have more then one image you can use the [`additional_image_link`](/feeds/offer/fields/additional_image_link.md) attribute to include more. üìÑÔ∏è is_bundle This attribute indicates if the offer is a bundle of products (mobile phone and subscription or DSLR camera and additional lens etc). It is **optional** in most countries, but **required** for products sold on French market. üìÑÔ∏è item_group_id This attribute is strongly recommended for fashion and beauty segment. It helps us group variant offers and present relevant offers to the users. üìÑÔ∏è link We need links to be able to re-direct users to your product page. In the link attribute you provide the URL for your product page. üìÑÔ∏è material It is recommended to use this attribute in Fashion categories. Add it to improve search results and listing. üìÑÔ∏è member_price This is product price that is active for users with active membership üìÑÔ∏è mpn Add valid MPN, manufacturer part number for the specific product. MPN is a unique number which identifies specific products among a manufacturer's product range. The numbers are used by shoppers to find specifically what they are looking for. MPNs help Prisjakt index your offers more efficiently. üìÑÔ∏è pattern Using this attribute is strongly recommended for Fashion categories. üìÑÔ∏è price Use this attribute to tell customers what you charge for your product. A price can be overridden by a [`sale_price`](/feeds/offer/fields/sale_price.md) during a given time period using [`sale_price_effective_date`](/feeds/offer/fields/sale_price_effective_date.md) or it may be complemented for members by using [`member_price`](/feeds/offer/fields/member_price.md). üìÑÔ∏è prisjakt_id Add this information if you know to which Prisjakt product we should match your product. üìÑÔ∏è product_detail In this attribute add all structured information about the product. üìÑÔ∏è product_type It's strongly recommended to use this attribute if [`google_product_category`](/feeds/offer/fields/google_product_category.md) is not present. üìÑÔ∏è promotion_id The `promotion_id` field allows mapping your inventory to promotions. Offer is mapped to promotion by [`promotion_id`](/feeds/promotion/fields/promotion_id.md) in promotion feed. üìÑÔ∏è sale_price It should be the same as the currently active sales price on your product page. If the sales is inactive it should be empty or [`sale_price_effective_date`](sale_price_effective_date.md) attribute should be used. üìÑÔ∏è sale_price_effective_date Datetime range indicating when [`sale_price`](/feeds/offer/fields/sale_price.md) is active. If you don't submit this attribute [`sale_price`](/feeds/offer/fields/sale_price.md) always applies. üìÑÔ∏è shipping The `shipping` attribute is used to set cost, time and methods of delivery. Please note, that `shipping` is **required** for all products sold on French market. üìÑÔ∏è shipping_height It is recommended to add this attribute if delivery costs based on dimensions. üìÑÔ∏è shipping_label Shipping label allows mapping your inventory to specific shipping service. Please see our [documentation for shipping services for details](https://support.prisjakt.nu/en/articles/5807189-shipping-services). üìÑÔ∏è shipping_length It is recommended to add this attribute if delivery costs based on dimensions. üìÑÔ∏è shipping_weight It is recommended to add this attribute if delivery costs based on weight. üìÑÔ∏è shipping_width It is recommended to add this attribute if delivery costs based on dimensions. üìÑÔ∏è size Used to describe size in **fashion categories**. It is recommended to add this attribute for fashion products to improve results and listing. üìÑÔ∏è size_system Using this attribute is required if [`size`](size.md) is specified for a product. üìÑÔ∏è title It should contain the full product name. The title is used to clearly state what product your shop is selling. It's the **most important attribute** for Prisjakt to be able to index your product/offer correctly. It should contain a manufacturer name along with product name or model. Including size, color and gender is recommended for product types that specifies this. These fields are available in Offer feeds.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use the availability attribute to display your stock status.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Enables us to indicate if a customer can order the product

searchDocs.title: Allowed Enum Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: download When the product is made digitally available, eg. game or software downloads in_stock You're currently accepting orders for this product and can fulfill the purchase request directly. out_of_stock You're not currently accepting orders for this product. preorder You're currently taking orders for this product, but it's not yet been released for sale. You're required to provide the availability date availability_date attribute to indicate the day that the product becomes available for delivery. backorder The product is not available at the moment, but you're accepting orders and it'll be shipped as soon as it becomes available again. This status can be combined with the availability date availability_date attribute to indicate the day that the product becomes available for delivery.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Value must be one of the allowed enum values

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use up-to-date stock info

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Don't use out of stock when the shop is temporarily downDon't use out of stock when you want to remove the product from the listingDon't use out of stock for products that are discontinued

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid availability value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively.  XMLCSV Valid Value <g:availability>download</g:availability> Click to show more valid XML examples <g:availability>download</g:availability> <g:availability>in_stock</g:availability> <g:availability>out_of_stock</g:availability> <g:availability>preorder</g:availability> <g:availability_date>2021-03-21</g:availability_date> <g:availability>backorder</g:availability> <g:availability_date>2021-03-21</g:availability_date>

searchDocs.title: Error Codes‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Below you will find possible error codes generated when validating this field alongside with an example in XML and CSV that would trigger the code. Please refer to the validation rules to understand the cause.  XMLCSV validation_invalid_enum <g:availability>unknown</g:availability> validation_missing_value <g:availability></g:availability>

searchDocs.title: Changelog‚Äã
searchDocs.content: üìÖ 2024-05-14 Removed Enum value not_available_for_purchase is no longer supported. Please use out_of_stock instead. üìÖ 2023-09-14 Deprecated Enum value backorder does not require availability_date to be set anymore. üìÖ 2023-03-20 Deprecated Enum value download is now deprecated and should not be used anymore. Download is a delivery option and should be specified using the shipping field. üìÖ 2023-03-17 Deprecated Enum value pickup has been removed and should not be used anymore. Using pickup value would result in validation error. Pickup is a delivery option and should be specified using the shipping field. üìÖ 2023-03-13 Changed Offers with value out_of_stock are no longer orderable. See deprecation notice below. Deprecated Value not_available_for_purchase should no longer be used, please use out_of_stock instead üìÖ 2023-01-05 Deprecated Enum value pickup is now deprecated and should not be used anymore. Pickup is a delivery option and should be specified using the shipping field. üìÖ 2022-12-20 Deprecated Previously out_of_stock values were still orderable, from now on out_of_stock will not be orderable. If you want to represent a product that is not in stock but still orderable you should use backorder and set availability_date üìÖ 2022-12-08 Added New enum value backorder, this value should be used for products that are orderable but currently not in stock. üìÖ 2022-12-07 Added Initial definition

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This attribute is used to help us place products in relevant categories. It should contain full category path from Google Taxonomy or respective category id. If you don't know or have Google product category, submit product_type instead.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This information helps us to make the products discoverable and searchable for the users

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If id is used it must match an existing Google Product Category id (see references below)If category path is used, it must match Google Product Category path exactly (see references below)Use only one attribute of this type per product

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Prefer using id's instead of strings if possibleUse the most nested category possibleAvoid using root categoriesUse full category path or respective category id from the list (see references)Wrap in a CDATA element if using xml

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid google_product_category value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively. searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Identifier should be unique for every product and not be changed or re-used for other products, a good practice is to use SKUs as ids since they are unique.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Length must be between 1-36Must be uniqueOnly ascii charactersTrailing whitespace characters are not allowedDisallowed characters are ! + @ # $ % ^ & * < > ; :

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use SKUs as idsYou can follow Google format but in some rare cases we might reject some offers due to stricter validation.

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Re-use, if re-used, your product might end up indexed to the wrong Prisjakt productChange over time, if changed, the product will need to be indexed againDon't add whitespace characters (" ", "\n", "t") at the beginning or the end of the id field

searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid id value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively. searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use the GTIN attribute to submit a Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) | GS1. A GTIN uniquely identifies your product. Including this will help indexing your products faster on Pricespy.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use only one attribute of this type per productLength should be one of 0, 8, 12, 13, or 14 digits (UPC, EAN, JAN, or ISBN)Make sure that the check digit is present and correct using the GS1 Check digit calculatorDon't submit a GTIN in the restricted ranges. Restricted ranges have the following prefixes: 02, 04, or 2 (when gtin is 13-digit number)Don't submit a GTIN in the coupon ranges. Coupons have the following GS1 prefixes ranges: 05, 98‚Äì99 (when gtin is 13-digit number)GTINs with restricted prefixes from above are valid when gtin is 12 or 14-digit numberMust be an number

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Add it to improve search results and listing. If you have more then one image you can use the additional_image_link attribute to include more.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Adding image helps us indexing the productIn case of new products we can present the offer along with it's image. This makes it easier for users to find the product in the product listing.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Url length is limited to 2047 charactersMust be valid RFC 3986 uriMust have a protocol (eg. https)Must have a path (eg. .../my-product)Must be shorter than 2047 charactersUnicode characters must be url encoded

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Make sure the url is encodedIf product has variants, make sure the image presents the proper product variantPrefer using high resolution images at least 300x300 pixels size, the bigger size the betterThe product should be in the center of the imagePrefer a white background without added contentPrefer professional images, shadows from the camera flash or bad image setup is often an indicator of amateur images, although any image is better than no image

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Supply URIs to other things than imagesDon't put "stickers" in the images, eg. with "30% off" "new" or "SALE"Don't watermark the images eg. with the store logo or name

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid image_link value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively.  XMLCSV Valid Value <g:image_link>http://example.com/link</g:image_link> Click to show more valid XML examples <g:image_link>http://example.com/link</g:image_link> <g:image_link>https://example.com/link</g:image_link> <g:image_link>https://example.com/link(black)_(large)</g:image_link> <g:image_link>https://example.com/link#foo</g:image_link> <g:image_link><![CDATA[https://example.com/link?utm_source=1&utm_medium=2]]></g:image_link> <g:image_link>http://example.com/link-%E2%84%A2-mu-20%C2%B5m</g:image_link> <g:image_link>ftp://example.com/link</g:image_link>

searchDocs.title: Error Codes‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Below you will find possible error codes generated when validating this field alongside with an example in XML and CSV that would trigger the code. Please refer to the validation rules to understand the cause.  XMLCSV validation_invalid_length <g:image_link>https://example. (more than 2047 characters value)</g:image_link> validation_invalid_url <g:image_link>http://bar</g:image_link> validation_invalid_url_fragment <g:image_link>https://example.com/link##</g:image_link> validation_invalid_url_host <g:image_link>http://example%.com/link</g:image_link> validation_invalid_url_path <g:image_link>https://example.com/link[12-34]</g:image_link> validation_invalid_url_port <g:image_link>http://example.com:foo/link</g:image_link> validation_invalid_url_query <g:image_link>https://example.com/link?param=value^up-arrow</g:image_link> validation_url_scheme_not_allowed <g:image_link>foo://example.com/link</g:image_link> <g:image_link>ftps://example.com/link</g:image_link> <g:image_link>sftp://example.com/link</g:image_link>

searchDocs.content: Add valid MPN, manufacturer part number for the specific product. MPN is a unique number which identifies specific products among a manufacturer's product range. The numbers are used by shoppers to find specifically what they are looking for. MPNs help Prisjakt index your offers more efficiently.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Including this will help indexing your products faster on Pricespy.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Only MPNs created by a manufacturer should be added here.

searchDocs.content: Do not include extra charges in the cost (such as shipping cost)Do not use thousand separators or similar in the value (while we may handle some of these cases we recommend you to just send plain numbers like 10000.50 SEK)

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: It's strongly recommended to use this attribute if google_product_category is not present.

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Include the complete category hierarchy, such as Home & Garden > Furniture > Living Room. Categories should be separated by >, | or /.Product should only exist in one category. If the product fits in multiple categories, choose the most relevant one.

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Refrain from including categories such as "Apple," "Sale," or "Black Friday 2023."When using XML, always use a distinct <product_type> tag for each category instead of combining them within one tag.

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid product_type value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively. searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Datetime range indicating when sale_price is active. If you don't submit this attribute sale_price always applies.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This will cause sale_price to be applied only within interval specified by start and end datetime

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Standard: ISO 8601Up to 51 charactersTwo dates separated with "/" (ISO 8601)Start and end must be within one year from current date

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Start datetime shall be earlier than stop datetime

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you don't include time, start time default to 12 AM CET (midnight) of start day and stop time is set to 23:59:59 of stop dayDon't set start or end datetime further than one year in the future. This will cause warning in feed validation. Moreover sale_price_effective_date and sale_price won't be used in product listing.

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid sale_price_effective_date value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively.  XMLCSV Valid Value <g:sale_price_effective_date>2016-02-24T13:00:00-08:00/2016-02-29T15:30:00+02:00</g:sale_price_effective_date> <g:sale_price>11.50 SEK</g:sale_price> Click to show more valid XML examples <g:sale_price_effective_date>2016-02-24T13:00:00-08:00/2016-02-29T15:30:00+02:00</g:sale_price_effective_date> <g:sale_price>11.50 SEK</g:sale_price> <g:sale_price_effective_date></g:sale_price_effective_date> <g:sale_price>11.50 SEK</g:sale_price> <g:sale_price_effective_date>2016-02-24/2016-02-26</g:sale_price_effective_date> <g:sale_price>11.50 SEK</g:sale_price>

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The shipping attribute is used to set cost, time and methods of delivery. Please note, that shipping is required for all products sold on French market.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This information will be visible for the users in offer listing.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Submit complete shipping informationHandling time and transit time should be specified in days.Overestimate if you can't provide accurate shipping costSubmit shipping cost including VAT, use local currencyIf you provide information about handling or transit time then min_handling_time should be lesser or equal to max_handling_time and min_transit_time should be lesser or equal to max_transit_timeAttribute carrier can be any string value up to 50 characters, but only the following values will be represented with icons airmee, best, bring, budbee, city, dachser, db, dhl, dooris, early, fedex, instabox, jetpak, postnord, ups, glsAttribute delivery_type can only take specific enum values. If the provided value is not in the allowed enum values or is not provided, the status is unset. Allowed values are in_store_pickup, home, mailbox, package_locker, service_point

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Keep shipping information as precise as possible. Add multiple shipping attributes if shipping cost or time varies for different country, region or service.If any of min_handling_time, max_handling_time, min_transit_time, max_transit_time is present then all those fields must be present for the current shipping item.

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Don't provide comma or point as separator for both thousands and fractional part of the shipping price, i.e. we don't support 1,000,00 SEK and 1.000.00 SEK formats

searchDocs.title: Offer File Formats
searchDocs.content: Offer File Formats info While we support a number of file formats, we recommend using the Prisjakt XML format for the best performance, most features and the least risk of errors. üìÑÔ∏è Prisjakt XML Our own format, the recommended format to use üìÑÔ∏è Prisjakt CSV Our own format as CSV, legacy support only üìÑÔ∏è Google Merchant Product XML Google Merchant Product Data Specification as XML üìÑÔ∏è Google Merchant Product CSV Google Merchant Product Data Specification as CSV üìÑÔ∏è Awin XML Awin affiliate feed format üìÑÔ∏è Rakuten XML Rakuten affiliate feed format üìÑÔ∏è Tradedoubler XML Tradedoubler affiliate feed format

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: It should contain the full product name. The title is used to clearly state what product your shop is selling. It's the most important attribute for Prisjakt to be able to index your product/offer correctly. It should contain a manufacturer name along with product name or model. Including size, color and gender is recommended for product types that specifies this.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use only one title attribute per productLength must be between 1-255 characters

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Add full product nameUse the same title as it is present on your product pageAdd variant information if applicable: colour, size, gender etc.Preferred syntax [brand] + [model name] + [additional product information]Use language of the specific market where the product is being sold (for better user experience)

searchDocs.title: Don¬¥t‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Do not use HTML tag - Do not include promotional textDo not use tabs or extra spacesDo not write detailed information in title, this belongs in the description attribute

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid title value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively.  XMLCSV Valid Value <g:title><![CDATA[Samsung Galaxy S8 Black 128G]]></g:title> Click to show more valid XML examples <g:title><![CDATA[Samsung Galaxy S8 Black 128G]]></g:title>

searchDocs.title: Error Codes‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Below you will find possible error codes generated when validating this field alongside with an example in XML and CSV that would trigger the code. Please refer to the validation rules to understand the cause.  XMLCSV validation_invalid_length <g:title><![CDATA[aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa (more than 256 characters value)]]></g:title> validation_missing_value <g:title></g:title>

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Awin is partially supported for shops using the Awin affiliate network for quick onboarding to Prisjakt. But to fully utilize all features we recommend our Prisjakt XML format.

searchDocs.title: Mapings of Awin fields to Prisjakt fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Awin Field	Prisjakt Fieldmerchant_product_id	id product_name	title in_stock *1	availability condition	condition google_taxonomy	google_product_category merchant_deep_link	link product_price_old *2	price alternate_image_['one', 'two', 'three', 'four']	additional_image_link MISSING	adult aw_deep_link	affiliate_link MISSING	age_group MISSING	availability_date brand_name	brand colour	color description	description MISSING	energy_efficiency_class suitable_for	gender product_gtin *3	gtin merchant_image_url *4	image_link MISSING	is_bundle MISSING	item_group_id MISSING	marketplace_retailer MISSING	material mpn *5	mpn MISSING	pattern MISSING	product_detail:section_name, MISSING	product_detail:attribute_name, MISSING	product_detail:attribute_value, product_type *6	product_type MISSING	promotion_id display_price	sale_price MISSING	sale_price_effective_date MISSING	delta_command MISSING	shipping:country, delivery_cost	shipping:price, MISSING	shipping:service, MISSING	shipping:region, MISSING	shipping:min_transit_time, MISSING	shipping:max_transit_time, MISSING	shipping:min_handling_time, MISSING	shipping:max_handling_time, MISSING	shipping_height MISSING	shipping_label MISSING	shipping_length MISSING	shipping_weight MISSING	shipping_width size	size MISSING	size_system MISSING	pause  *1 availability - If `in_stock` field is 1, availability is "in stock" - If `in_stock` field is missing use `stock_quantity` or `stock_status` fields to determine availability   *2 price - Use `dispaly_price` as price when sale_price is not defined. - If `sale_price` is defined, `display_price` become `sale_price` and regular price is in `product_price_old`.   *3 gtin - Use `product_gtin` if field is present. - If `product_gtin` field is missing use `isbn` or `ean` or `upc` fields to determine `gtin`   *4 image_link - Use `merchant_image_url` if field is present. - If `merchant_image_url` field is missing use `aw_image_url` or `large_image` to determine `image_link`   *5 mpn - Use `mpn` if field i available. - If `mpn` field is missing use `model_number` to determine `mpn`   *6 product_type - Use `product_type` if field is present. - If `product_type` field is missing use `merchant_category`, `merchant_product_category_path` or `category_name` to determine `product_type`

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Using this attribute is required if size is specified for a product.

searchDocs.title: Allowed Enum Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: au br cn de eu fr it jp mex uk us

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Must be one of the allowed enum values

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use accepted size systemsDo not create own size systems

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Our CSV format has the same semantic fields and rules as our Prisjakt XML format. The only difference is that the data is separated by commas instead of XML tags. How to properly encode nested attributes in csv is described in our section about encoding sub-attributes  warning The CSV format is not recommended as it is poorly defined and have issues when it comes to encoding and escaping. We recommend using the Prisjakt XML format instead if possible.

searchDocs.content: Rakuten is partially supported for shops using the Rakuten affiliate network for quick onboarding to Prisjakt. But to fully utilize all features we recommend our Prisjakt XML format.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Product feeds are a way for manufacturers to provide us with detailed product data for the products they create. This data is used to create a product catalog that can be used to create product listings on the site.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Tradedoubler is partially supported for shops using the Tradadoubler affiliate network for quick onboarding to Prisjakt. But to fully utilize all features we recommend our Prisjakt XML format.

searchDocs.title: Condition Field‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If condition field is not included in your feed, then it will be automatically set it to new. However, it is highly recommended to include this field in your feed for better accuracy and completeness. Including the condition field helps ensure that the product information is up-to-date and provides a better experience for users. It allows for more precise categorization and improves the overall quality of the data. By setting the condition field to new when it is not provided, you can maintain a consistent standard, but including the actual condition of the product is always the best practice.

searchDocs.title: Via Upload‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Create/generate a feed file Request access to our API, once approved we will give your a unique identifier for your feed (feed-id) Use the API to upload a new version of the feed file curl -X 'POST' \ [17:09:11] 'https://api.schibsted.com/prisjakt/feed-api-v4/brands/product-feeds/<your-feed-id>/upload' \ -H 'accept: application/json' \ -H 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data' \ -F 'feed_file=@product-feed.xml' \ -H 'client_id: <your-client-id>' \ -H 'client_secret: <your-client-secret>' Benefits: You can update the feed whenever you wantChanges propagate fast (within minutes after upload)

searchDocs.title: Via Our Support‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Create/generate a feed fileSend the url to support@prisjakt.nu and we will set it up for youBenefits: Simple and easy to get started Drawbacks: Will not auto update until you send anotherDepending on workload of our support it can take time to set up

searchDocs.title: Product Fields
searchDocs.content: Product Fields üìÑÔ∏è brand The brand attribute is used to indicate a product's brand/manufacturer name. üìÑÔ∏è description Use it to add unstructured product information üìÑÔ∏è gtin Use the GTIN attribute to submit a [Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) | GS1](https://www.gs1.org/standards/id-keys/gtin). A GTIN uniquely identifies your product. Including this will help indexing your products faster on Pricespy. üìÑÔ∏è id Identifier should be unique for every product and not be changed or re-used for other products, a good practice is to use SKUs as ids since they are unique. üìÑÔ∏è image_link Add it to improve search results and listing. If you have more then one image you can use the [`additional_image_link`](/feeds/offer/fields/additional_image_link.md) attribute to include more. üìÑÔ∏è item_group_id This attribute is strongly recommended for fashion and beauty segment. It helps us group variant offers and present relevant offers to the users. üìÑÔ∏è mpn Add valid MPN, manufacturer part number for the specific product. MPN is a unique number which identifies specific products among a manufacturer's product range. The numbers are used by shoppers to find specifically what they are looking for. MPNs help Prisjakt index your offers more efficiently. üìÑÔ∏è product_detail In this attribute add all structured information about the product. üìÑÔ∏è suggested_retail_price The Suggested Retail Price is the price that a product‚Äôs manufacturer recommends it should be sold for in retail stores. üìÑÔ∏è title Title is the **most important attribute** for Prisjakt to be able to index your product/offer correctly. It should contain manufacturer name along with product name and/or model. Additionally size, color and gender is recommended for product types that specifies this. These fields are available in Product feeds.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Our feed format is an extension of the Google Merchant Product Data Specification, and as such these fields will be usable for other systems that support Google Product feeds.

searchDocs.title: Prisjakt Specific Fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In order to be able to provide you with extra functionality we sometimes add extra fields that can be used for an even better experience at Prisjakt for your customers.  These fields are all specified in the Prisjakt namespace and are not part of the Google Merchant Product Data Specification.  Currently, our Prisjakt specific fields are:  prisjakt_idmember_priceaffiliate_linkshipping delivery_typecarrier

searchDocs.title: Required Fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: There are some fields, we simply cannot be without such as a link to your offer, a price and an title. If any of these fields are missing, your whole offer will be omitted.  The following fields are required for an offer to show, you can see an example of the minimal required fields in action here  AvailabilityConditionIdLinkPriceTitle

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The brand attribute is used to indicate a product's brand/manufacturer name.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Length must be between 1-70 characters

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use only valid brands

searchDocs.title: Don't‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Don't set N/A, generic, no name, unknown and similar brand names as they are of no help when indexing your products/offers

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid brand value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively.  XMLCSV Valid Value <g:brand><![CDATA[Prisjakt]]></g:brand> Click to show more valid XML examples <g:brand><![CDATA[Prisjakt]]></g:brand> <g:brand><![CDATA[Sony]]></g:brand>

searchDocs.content: Below you will find possible error codes generated when validating this field alongside with an example in XML and CSV that would trigger the code. Please refer to the validation rules to understand the cause.  XMLCSV validation_invalid_length <g:brand><![CDATA[aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa (more than 70 characters value)]]></g:brand>

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use the GTIN attribute to submit a Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) | GS1. A GTIN uniquely identifies your product. Including this will help indexing your products faster on Pricespy.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use only one attribute of this type per productLength should be one of 0, 8, 12, 13, or 14 digits (UPC, EAN, JAN, or ISBN)Make sure that the check digit is present and correct using the GS1 Check digit calculatorDon't submit a GTIN in the restricted ranges. Restricted ranges have the following prefixes: 02, 04, or 2 (when gtin is 13-digit number)Don't submit a GTIN in the coupon ranges. Coupons have the following GS1 prefixes ranges: 05, 98‚Äì99 (when gtin is 13-digit number)GTINs with restricted prefixes from above are valid when gtin is 12 or 14-digit numberMust be an number

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This attribute is strongly recommended for fashion and beauty segment. It helps us group variant offers and present relevant offers to the users.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: With this attribute we're able to present the user a list of available

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Length must be between 1-50 characters

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Make sure the combination of item_group_id and other variant specific attributes like color, size and pattern are consistent

searchDocs.title: Don't‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Be extra careful and don't mix up id and item_group_id

searchDocs.content: üìÖ 2024-03-30 Added Initial definition

searchDocs.title: References‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Google Manufacturer Specification

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Identifier should be unique for every product and not be changed or re-used for other products, a good practice is to use SKUs as ids since they are unique.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Length must be between 1-36Must be uniqueOnly ascii charactersTrailing whitespace characters are not allowedDisallowed characters are ! + @ # $ % ^ & * < > ; :

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use SKUs as idsYou can follow Google format but in some rare cases we might reject some offers due to stricter validation.

searchDocs.title: Don't‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Re-use, if re-used, your product might end up indexed to the wrong Prisjakt productChange over time, if changed, the product will need to be indexed againDon't add whitespace characters (" ", "\n", "t") at the beginning or the end of the id field

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Add valid MPN, manufacturer part number for the specific product. MPN is a unique number which identifies specific products among a manufacturer's product range. The numbers are used by shoppers to find specifically what they are looking for. MPNs help Prisjakt index your offers more efficiently.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Including this will help indexing your products faster on Pricespy.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Length must be between 1-70 characters

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Only MPNs created by a manufacturer should be added here.

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid mpn value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively.  XMLCSV Valid Value <g:mpn>SM-G920F</g:mpn> Click to show more valid XML examples <g:mpn>SM-G920F</g:mpn> <g:mpn>MGCH3LL/A</g:mpn>

searchDocs.content: üìÖ 2024-03-30 Added Initial definition

searchDocs.title: References‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Google Manufacturer Specification

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Add it to improve search results and listing. If you have more then one image you can use the additional_image_link attribute to include more.

searchDocs.title: Effects When Used‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Adding image helps us indexing the productIn case of new products we can present the offer along with it's image. This makes it easier for users to find the product in the product listing.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Url length is limited to 2047 charactersMust be valid RFC 3986 uriMust have a protocol (eg. https)Must have a path (eg. .../my-product)Must be shorter than 2047 charactersUnicode characters must be url encoded

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Make sure the url is encodedIf product has variants, make sure the image presents the proper product variantPrefer using high resolution images at least 300x300 pixels size, the bigger size the betterThe product should be in the center of the imagePrefer a white background without added contentPrefer professional images, shadows from the camera flash or bad image setup is often an indicator of amateur images, although any image is better than no image

searchDocs.title: Don't‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Supply URIs to other things than imagesDon't put "stickers" in the images, eg. with "30% off" "new" or "SALE"Don't watermark the images eg. with the store logo or name

searchDocs.content: Google Manufacturer Specification

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Title is the most important attribute for Prisjakt to be able to index your product/offer correctly. It should contain manufacturer name along with product name and/or model. Additionally size, color and gender is recommended for product types that specifies this.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Length should be between 1-255

searchDocs.title: Do‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use the same title as it is present on your product pagePreferred syntax is [brand] + [model name] + [additional product information]Use language of the specific market where the product is being sold (for better user experience)Embed in a CDATA tag if using xml in order to avoid any potential issues with special characters

searchDocs.title: Don't‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Avoid commas, tabs, extra spaces, newlines and other special characters (especially if you use CSV format)Do not use HTML tags or any other codesDo not include promotional textDo not write detailed information in title, this belongs in the description attribute

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid title value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively.  XMLCSV Valid Value <g:title><![CDATA[Samsung Galaxy S8 Black 128G]]></g:title> Click to show more valid XML examples <g:title><![CDATA[Samsung Galaxy S8 Black 128G]]></g:title>

searchDocs.title: Product File Formats
searchDocs.content: Product File Formats info While we support a number of file formats, we recommend using the format based on your use case as follows For books, it's likely that your system is already capable of generating the industry standard Onix formatFor appliances, the TradeXML is the best format as it uses the EU standardized PI formatIn all other cases (and for the greatest precision and flexibility) you should use the Prisjakt Manufacturer XML as it is an extension of the Google Manufacturer XML Format üóÉÔ∏è Prisjakt Manufacturer XML 1 item üìÑÔ∏è Google Manufacturer XML Description üìÑÔ∏è Trade XML We support the TradeXML format defined by Tradeplace which is an extension of the PI Standard format defined by Applia Europe üìÑÔ∏è Onix For Books XML If your products are books, we support the Onix For Books XML format to import your products.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Suggested Retail Price is the price that a product‚Äôs manufacturer recommends it should be sold for in retail stores.

searchDocs.title: Validation Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Must be a number (value) followed by a space and a currency (unit)Number may have two decimals, separated by a . (dot)Currency must be three upper case characters and a valid ISO 4217 currencyZero prices are not allowed

searchDocs.title: Don't‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Do not include extra charges in the cost (such as shipping cost)Do not use thousand separators or similar in the value (while we may handle some of these cases we recommend you to just send plain numbers like 10000.50 SEK)

searchDocs.title: Example Values‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Here are examples of how a valid suggested_retail_price value should look like in XML and CSV (with header) respectively.  XMLCSV Valid Value <g:suggested_retail_price>99.99 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> Click to show more valid XML examples <g:suggested_retail_price>99.99 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>100 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>SEK 100</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>99,99 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>10,000.00 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>10 000.00 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>10.000 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>1.144.000 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price>

searchDocs.title: Error Codes‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Below you will find possible error codes generated when validating this field alongside with an example in XML and CSV that would trigger the code. Please refer to the validation rules to understand the cause.  XMLCSV validation_missing_currency <g:suggested_retail_price>100$</g:suggested_retail_price> validation_missing_price_value <g:suggested_retail_price>SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> validation_not_number <g:suggested_retail_price>10.0.00.00 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>10.0.00.00 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>foo SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> validation_not_positive_number <g:suggested_retail_price>-10 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> <g:suggested_retail_price>0 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> validation_price_out_of_range <g:suggested_retail_price>1000000000 SEK</g:suggested_retail_price> validation_unknown_currency <g:suggested_retail_price>$100</g:suggested_retail_price>

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Google Manufacturer Product Data Specification is supported directly by Prisjakt. But as the product_detail field is vaguely defined we have extended the format into our own Prisjakt Manufacturer XML format that should be preferred.

searchDocs.title: Attribute Mapper
searchDocs.content: Attribute Mapper This tool helps in mapping your product attributes to Prisjakt's taxonomy via the product_detail field. Select all attributes that you want to send to us to generate example field values, then include them for each product item in your feed. You can see a full feed example here. warning Our attributes and categories are constantly evolving. We recommend that you check back here regularly to ensure that you are sending us the most up-to-date attributes.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Promotion feeds help you automate creation of promotions for your products, this is useful when you have a high volume of promotions and/or when you want to automate integration with us. For smaller volumes or manual handling of promotions, please use our Business Center.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Prisjakt Manufacturer XML is based upon Google Manufacturer Product Data Specification and then extended. This is currently our primary way of ingesting product data from manufacturers.  info Use the product_detail field to send your properties/attributes in a structured formatUse the Attribute Mapper to assist you in finding mappings for your properties/attributes to Prisjakts equivalent

searchDocs.title: Required Fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The following fields are required for an product to ingest successfully:  IdGTINTitleBrandDescriptionImage Link

searchDocs.title: Via URL‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Create/generate a feed (or let your E-commerce tool generate it for youHost the feed on your own server and provide us with a url to fetch it from regularlyAdd the url in Business Center Make sure to choose the Promotion feed type when adding Benefits: You can update the feed whenever you wantYou can see when we last fetched the feedYou can see if there are any errors in the feedChanges propagate fast (within hours depending on your SLA)

searchDocs.title: Promotion Fields
searchDocs.content: Promotion Fields üìÑÔ∏è coupon_value_type Defines type of the promotion üìÑÔ∏è description Promotion description. üìÑÔ∏è image_link Link to the image that features the promotion or promotional item. üìÑÔ∏è item_id Identifier should be unique for every promotion item and not be changed or re-used for other promotion items, a good practice is to use SKUs as ids since they are unique. üìÑÔ∏è long_title Full title of the promotion. Should describe the promotion completely and accurately. üìÑÔ∏è promotion_effective_dates Defines the time period when the promotion is active. üìÑÔ∏è promotion_id Identifier should be unique for every promotion. Attribute is used to map promotion to a product. In the offer feed, [`promotion_id`](/feeds/offer/fields/promotion_id.md) field is used to map a promotion to a product. üìÑÔ∏è promotion_page_link Link to the promotion page. These fields are available in Promotion feeds.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Google Promotion Feed Specification is directly supported. But to fully utilize all features we recommend our Prisjakt Promotion XML format which is an extension of Google Promotion Feed.

searchDocs.title: Infrastructure
searchDocs.content: Infrastructure üìÑÔ∏è Web Server Configuration For optimal results it is preferable if you host your feeds with the support for the following features and configuration, please see your web server/cloud provider documentation of how to set them up. üóÉÔ∏è Transport Protocols 2 items üóÉÔ∏è Authenticated Feeds 4 items

searchDocs.title: Authenticated Feeds
searchDocs.content: Authenticated Feeds üìÑÔ∏è HTTP Basic Authentication We support that you put your feeds protected behind HTTP basic authentication. Credentials can be set in Business Center. üìÑÔ∏è HTTP Digest Authentication We support that you put your feeds protected behind HTTP digest authentication. Credentials can be set in Business Center. üìÑÔ∏è Ftp Credentials For legacy we support ftp authentication. Credentials can be set in Business Center. üìÑÔ∏è Header Authentication We support that you put your feeds protected by authentication header. Header name and value can be set in Business Center. Sometimes you want to limit the traffic to your feed or allow only certain actors (like us) to access your data. We support that you publish you feed with authentication and provide us credentials so that our agents can access your feed. Please contact us at support@prisjakt.nu if you wan¬¥t to supply us with credentials. We use dynamically assigned ip¬¥s We do not support a configuration where you allow only certain ips. Our agents are cloud based and spin up and change after load, hence they get dynamically assigned ip addresses that vary.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Most fields in use in our feed are also part of the Google Promotions Feed Specification, and as such these fields will be usable for other systems that support Google Product feeds.  info The promotion feed is designed primarily for system integrations, enabling automated processes to handle promotions efficiently. For tasks that require manual intervention, we recommend using the BC UI, which is specifically invented for human interaction and it's easy of use. Mixing the promotion feed with manual processes in the BC UI can lead to confusion and misconfiguration, so it's best to keep their usage separate to maintain clarity and streamline operations.

searchDocs.title: Prisjakt Specific Feeds‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In order to be able to provide you with extra functionality we sometimes add extra fields that can be used for an even better experience at Prisjakt for your customers.  Currently, our Prisjakt specific fields are:  promotion_page_link  The fields are also defined in our promotions feeds xml namespace

searchDocs.title: Promotion Required Fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: There are some fields, we simply cannot be without when ingestion your promotion. If any of these fields are missing, your whole promotion will be omitted.  The following fields are required for us to correctly index your promotion and assign it to offers.  Promotion IdLong titleCoupon value typePromotion effective dates

searchDocs.title: Promotion Optional Fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: DescriptionItem idImage linkPromotion page link
